availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Squire Jones (Henry County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Isaiah Jones and Mahala Jones. Married to Margaret Lowden Jones. Father of Mahala Ann Jones, Mary E. Jones, James Jones, Sarah Jane Jones, and John Jones. Farmer in Henry County in 1850. Farmer in Henry County in 1860. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a private from August 22, 1862, to March 13, 1863. Died in Post Hospital at Lebanon, Marion County, Kentucky, on March 13, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, District No. 1, p. 408A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry County, Subdivision No. 1, p. 283.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0097.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #25048.
